abilities.name: Psymimic
abilities.text: Once during your turn, instead of Alakazam's normal attack, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks. Alakazam copies that attack including its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Alakazam's type is still Psychic.) This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Syncroblast
attacks.text: If Alakazam and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 80.

abilities.name: Energy Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

abilities.name: Miraculous Powder
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Butterfree is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from Butterfree.

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Reaction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Jet Stream
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Blastoise is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to Blastoise, if any. Then, if there are any Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon, choose 1 of them and discard it. This power can't be used if Blastoise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy Cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Moonlight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a card from your hand back on your deck. If you do, search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Clefable is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Auto Fire
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Burning Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all basic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Scorching Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 of them is tails, discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard. If both are tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Charizard.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Tailwind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may reduce your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost to 0.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Major Tsunami
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Feraligatr is your Active Pokémon and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. Either way, if you have any Benched Pokémon, switch Feraligatr with 1 of them. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rending Jaws
attacks.text: If here are no damage counters on the Defending Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 70.

abilities.name: Rock Body
abilities.text: All damage done by attacks to Golem is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Giant Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Chaos Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 3 or fewer Prizes, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

abilities.name: Terraforming
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck and rearrange them as you like. This power can't be used if Machamp is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Iron Fist
attacks.text: Count the number of Pokémon you have in play with damage counters on them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of those Pokémon.

data.name: Magby
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Catch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Super Psywave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Count the number of Energy cards attached to that Pokémon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Soothing Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Mislead
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Ethereal Flame
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Ninetales. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each card discarded this way.

abilities.name: Beating Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pidgeot is your Active Pokémon, you may shuffle 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Pidgeot is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sharp Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Plunge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Poliwrath is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, take all Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, if any, and attach them to Poliwrath. Then switch Poliwrath with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Water Energy attached to Poliwrath. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Raichu.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu or this attack does nothing.

data.name: Pichu
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Patch
attacks.text: Take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Steel Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Air Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Dark Aura
abilities.text: All Energy attached to Tyranitar is Darkness Energy instead of its usual type.

attacks.name: Stamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage and does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, if any. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Heat Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may count the total number of Energy cards attached to all of your Pokémon and all of your opponent's Pokémon. If your opponent has more total Energy cards attached, you may search your deck for 1 Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Harvest Bounty
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you attach an Energy card to your Active Pokémon as part of your turn, you may attach an additional Energy card to that Pokémon at the same time. This power can't be used if Venusaur is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Poison Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused.

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Misfire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 6 damage counters on Weezing.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Venusaur, if it has any.

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Foul Gas

abilities.name: Poison Pollen

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused.

attacks.name: Bind Wound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (1 if it has only 1).

attacks.name: Dogpile
attacks.text: Count the number of Pokémon on your Bench. This attack does 10 times that number of damage to the Defending Pokémon, and Chansey does 10 times that number of damage to itself.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon.

attacks.name: Mysterious Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Croconaw does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Spiral Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Electabuzz. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Electabuzz, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Flaaffy does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Sleep Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if he or she has only 1). This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 30 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Asleep, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Energy Recall
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to Kadabra (1 if you have only 1).

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Ice Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches the Defending Pokémon with it. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flaming Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magmar does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

attacks.name: Sleep Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lightning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Tauros does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Energy Removal 2
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Copycat
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, count the number of cards in your opponent's hand and draw that many cards.

data.name: Dual Ball
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card other than a Baby Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

data.name: Pokémon Reversal
rules: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Flip a coin. If heads, switch that Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Multi Technical Machine 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Multi Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Power Charge
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck (1 if you have only 1).

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bill's Maintenance
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
If you have any cards in your hand, shuffle 1 of them into your deck, then draw 3 cards.

data.name: Mary's Impulse
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

data.name: Master Ball
rules: Look at 7 cards from the top of your deck. You may choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from those cards, show it your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck.

data.name: Pokémon Nurse
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. Then discard all Energy cards attached to it, if any.

data.name: Professor Elm's Training Method
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: Strength Charm
rules: Attach Strength Charm to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

Whenever an attack from the Pokémon that Strength Charm is attached to does damage (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of your turn in which this happens, discard Strength Charm.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Professor Oak's Research
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

data.name: Warp Point
rules: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any; then you switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Moo-Moo Milk
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from that Pokémon. If the Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to does damage with an attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of every turn, put 1 damage counter on the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to, unless it's Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal, whenever it damages a Pokémon by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Potion
rules: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (1 if that Pokémon has only 1).

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
